MIT研發自駕車轉角前瞻功能

05 Nov 2019, 13:43

【新唐人北京時間2019年11月05日訊】麻省理工學院的研究者們在開發一套前瞻轉角物體的功能，利用地面陰影的變化探測前方側面或者轉角是否有移動的物體。這在自動駕駛的汽車、機器人或自動輪椅等方面有很好的應用前景。
這個版本基於2017年和2018年展示的版本做了改進。研究者對一輛停在車庫里的汽車進行的實驗中，新系統探測到其它移動車輛並剎車的反應速度，比傳統的利用激光進行探測的系統快了半秒。
半秒的差別，對於高速行進中的自動駕駛汽車，意味著嚴重車禍和「有驚無險」的差別。
研究者表示，這種系統還可以用於機器人，為機器人在繁忙的走道中自由移動進行導航；或者用於自動移動的輪椅，幫助其在醫院的走廊里順利移動。
不過目前這個系統只在室內的環境測試過。室內環境下，光照和陰影的情形相對比較穩定。
這種技術只是MIT在隔物探測領域研究的多種技術之一，其它技術包括使用雷達、人工智能，甚至Wi-Fi來實現探測的功能。
──轉自《大紀元》

MIT develops self-driving corner preview function

05 Nov 2019, 13:43

[New Tang Dynasty, Beijing time, November 05, 2019] Researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology are developing a set of forward-looking corners that use the change in ground shadows to detect moving objects on the front side or corners. This has a good application prospect in auto-driving cars, robots or automatic wheelchairs.
This version has been improved based on the versions shown in 2017 and 2018. In an experiment conducted by a researcher on a car parked in a garage, the new system detected the speed of reaction of other moving vehicles and brakes, which was half a second faster than the traditional laser-detected system.
The difference of half a second, for autonomous vehicles driving at high speeds, means the difference between a serious car accident and "sudden danger."
Researchers say the system can also be used for robots to navigate the free movement of the robot in busy walkways, or for wheelchairs that move automatically to help them move smoothly through the corridors of the hospital.
However, this system is currently only tested in indoor environments. In the indoor environment, the situation of light and shadow is relatively stable.
This technology is just one of many technologies that MIT has studied in the field of barrier detection. Other technologies include the use of radar, artificial intelligence, and even Wi-Fi to implement detection.
─Transfer from the Epoch Times
(Editor: Ye Ping)
